issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: I'm using eucalyptus/admin creds. I can run; [root@odc-d-06-02 eucalyptus]# euca-describe-availability-zones AVAILABILITYZONE cloud4 10.104.1.212 arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloud4:cluster:cc01/ AVAILABILITYZONE cloud4-sec 10.104.10.48 arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloud4-sec:cluster:cc02/ If I try to describe AS groups, I get; [root@odc-d-06-02 eucalyptus]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups: error (InvalidClientTokenId): The security token included in the request is invalid The --debug version is; [root@odc-d-06-02 eucalyptus]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --debug 2014-03-04 07:31:21,520 DEBUG DescribeAutoScalingGroups parsed arguments: {'userregion': None, 'AutoScalingGroupNames.member': [], 'url': None, 'show_long': False, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None} 2014-03-04 07:31:21,521 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 'autoscaling-url' 2014-03-04 07:31:21,521 DEBUG Config section 'aws:us-east-1' 2014-03-04 07:31:21,521 INFO Config option 'autoscaling-url' = 'https://autoscaling.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/' 2014-03-04 07:31:21,521 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 'verify-ssl' 2014-03-04 07:31:21,521 DEBUG Config section {'Action': 'DescribeAutoScalingGroups', 'Version': '2011-01-01'} 2014-03-04 07:31:21,525 INFO AutoScaling sending request (attempt 1 of 3) 2014-03-04 07:31:21,526 DEBUG QuerySigV2Auth string to sign: 'POST\nautoscaling.us-east-1.amazonaws.com\n/\nAWSAccessKeyId=AKINZZDOTQJF9LELTSLA&Action=DescribeAutoScalingGroups&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2014-03-04T15%3A31%3A21Z&Version=2011-01-01' 2014-03-04 07:31:21,526 DEBUG QuerySigV2Auth b64-encoded signature: 9Sd7Zuv9hKS/TuSP2o+Vi4f8uY3dQEjzZdpdqi1Q6/k= 2014-03-04 07:31:21,526 DEBUG QuerySigV2Auth converting params to POST data 2014-03-04 07:31:21,532 DEBUG AutoScaling request method: POST 2014-03-04 07:31:21,532 DEBUG AutoScaling request url: https://autoscaling.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/ 2014-03-04 07:31:21,532 DEBUG AutoScaling euca2ools.exceptions.AWSError: (403, 'Forbidden', 'InvalidClientTokenId', 'The security token included in the request is invalid')

comments.body: The command is running against AWS/AutoScaling.
ah! I see that in the request debug now! Closing...  I guess why is the next question, but I'll address that separately.
You'd need to have an enabled Auto Scaling service at the time credentials (eucarc) were downloaded.

I was actually tracking down a 503 error that I got using the console
against this same back end, and that 403 via euca2ools is just an
unfortunate problem I failed to identify prior to filing the bug. Still
seeing the 503. investigating more.


On Tue, Mar 4, 2014 at 6:20 PM, Steve Jones (JIRA) <
